answers.text:
Hello,
I found a few resources that might help answer your question.
The City of Woodbury developed a program where they cross train Police Officers Firefighters so they are both optimally prepared for first responding. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/100239/The_City_of_Woodburys_Police_Officer_Firefighter_Cross_Training_Program
This an assessment of the police basic training program in the City of Glendale, AZ.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/14861/Assessment_of_Police_Basic_Training_Needs_in_Arizona
In some police departments defibrillators are a part of basic training and first response responsibilities.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/2567/Police_and_AEDS_A_Chance_to_Save_Thousands_of_Lives_Each_Year 
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Chinn Park MAGIC
text:
The Prince William County Criminal Justice Academy has law enforcement recruits complete AHA CPR/AED and First Aid to meet first aid training objectives.  This training includes splinting, bandaging, and other first aid that is not of practical use for law enforcement officers in an urban/suburban work environment with rapid EMS availability.  The Academy is seeking alternatives to provide practical, relevant first aid training for law enforcement recruits.  Please send information on any basic first aid training provided law enforcement recruits to:
Captain Alfred E. Miller
Criminal Justice Academy Director
13101 Public Safety Drive
Nokesville, VA  20181
703.792.4525
amiller@pwcgov.org
title: First Aid Training for Law Enforcement
